Public Instance Methods

dirty_json_decode(json_string) click to toggle source

Used for a real quick and dirty JSON parser. It doesn’t do much, but it’s enough to when trying to test output generated by ActionView::Helpers::JavascriptHelper.options_for_ajax. Using a real JSON parser will bomb on output generated by this function. 

    # File spec/spec_helper.rb, line 33
33: def dirty_json_decode(json_string)
34:   json_string.gsub!(/^(\s*\{)/, "")
35:   if $1
36:     json_string.gsub!(/\s*\}\s*$/, "")
37:   end
38:   json_string.split(',').inject({}) do |memo, kv|
39:     (k,v) = kv.split(":", 2)
40:     v.strip!
41:     memo[k.strip] = case v
42:     when /^['"](.*?)['"]$/: $1
43:     when "true": true
44:     when "false": false
45:     else
46:       v
47:     end
48:     memo
49:   end
50: end
test_alias_method_chained(mod, message, feature, &block) click to toggle source 
    # File spec/spec_helper.rb, line 52
52: def test_alias_method_chained(mod, message, feature, &block)
53:   method_invoked = false
54:   stub(mod).alias_method_chain { |func, with| method_invoked = true if (message == func && feature == with) }
55:   yield block if block_given?
56:   method_invoked
57: end

Disabled; run with --debug to generate this.

[Validate]
